title: Static vector with mismatched function value causes compiler error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The following snippet tries to put a generic function into a non-generic function vector.

``` rust
fn foo<T>(_x: &T) {}

static FOOS: &'static [fn(&uint)] = &[foo];

fn main() {}
```

When I try to compile this with the current upstream master (a1b25f2f09485ccb3d5ca07e2886a9a6dc9bc16b), I get:

```
% ./rustc -L. datasets/rust3.rs
error: internal compiler error: type_of with ty_param
note: the compiler hit an unexpected failure path. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://static.rust-lang.org/doc/master/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
